channel.title: 64-bit computers
channel.description:
Hey Moparians. I'm using a 317 Delta client, trying to get it to run on a 64-bit computer.
Here's my run.bat: [code]@ECHO OFF color 0a
JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI[/code] Obviously this works on a 32-bit computer. I've tried to modify it several different ways, such as:
[code]@ECHO OFF color 0a
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\java.exe" -Xmx500m EGUI[/code] [code]@ECHO OFF color 0a
"C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\java.exe" -Xmx500m EGUI[/code] [code]@ECHO OFF color 0a
Javaw -Xmx500m EGUI[/code] [code]@ECHO OFF color 0a
"C:\Program Files (x86)Java\jre6\javaw.exe" -Xmx500m EGUI[/code] [code]@ECHO OFF color 0a
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_35\java.exe" -Xmx500m EGUI[/code] [code]@ECHO OFF color 0a
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_35\java.exe" -Xmx500m EGUI[/code]
Nothing's working. Any help?

item.title: 64-bit computers
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:


Try that, the java executable is located in the bin folder.

Try that, the java executable is located in the bin folder.

item.title: 64-bit computers
item.dc:creator: @PsychoScapeRSPS PsychoScapeRSPS
item.description:
@PsychoScapeRSPS wrote:

Hey Moparians.
I’m using a 317 Delta client, trying to get it to run on a 64-bit computer.

Here’s my run.bat:

[code]@ECHO OFF
color 0a

JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI[/code]
Obviously this works on a 32-bit computer.
I’ve tried to modify it several different ways, such as:

[code]@ECHO OFF
color 0a

“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI[/code]

[code]@ECHO OFF
color 0a

“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI[/code]

[code]@ECHO OFF
color 0a

Javaw -Xmx500m EGUI[/code]

[code]@ECHO OFF
color 0a

“C:\Program Files (x86)Java\jre6\javaw.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI[/code]

[code]@ECHO OFF
color 0a

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_35\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI[/code]

[code]@ECHO OFF
color 0a

“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_35\java.exe” -Xmx500m EGUI[/code]

Nothing’s working.
Any help?
